column2: Chapter XIII.
column3: Chapter thirteen.

column2: Kitty Keeps Her Birthday.
column3: Kitty Keeps Her Birthday.

column2: They were all assembled as usual at the breakfast-table.
column3: They were all assembled as usual at the breakfast table.

column2: Preferring the request suggested to her by Mrs. Presty, Kitty had hastened the presentation of the birthday gifts, by getting into her mother's bed in the morning, and exacting her mother's promise before she would consent to get out again.
column3: Preferring the request suggested to her by mrs Presty, Kitty had hastened the presentation of the birthday gifts, by getting into her mother's bed in the morning, and exacting her mother's promise before she would consent to get out again.

column2: By her own express wish, she was left in ignorance of what the presents would prove to be.
column3: By her own express wish, she was left in ignorance of what the presents would prove to be.

column2: Hide them from me, said this young epicure in pleasurable sensations, "and make me want to see them until I can bear it no longer." The gifts had accordingly been collected in an embrasure of one of the windows; and the time had now arrived when Kitty could bear it no longer.
column3: Hide them from me, said this young epicure in pleasurable sensations, "and make me want to see them until I can bear it no longer." The gifts had accordingly been collected in an embrasure of one of the windows; and the time had now arrived when Kitty could bear it no longer.

column2: In the procession of the presents, Mrs. Linley led the way.
column3: In the procession of the presents, mrs Linley led the way.

column2: She had passed behind the screen which had thus far protected the hidden treasures from discovery, and appeared again with a vision of beauty in the shape of a doll.
column3: She had passed behind the screen which had thus far protected the hidden treasures from discovery, and appeared again with a vision of beauty in the shape of a doll.

column2: The dress of this wonderful creature exhibited the latest audacities of French fashion.
column3: The dress of this wonderful creature exhibited the latest audacities of French fashion.

column2: Her head made a bow; her eyes went to sleep and woke again; she had a voice that said two words--more precious than two thousand in the mouth of a mere living creature. Kitty's arms opened and embraced her gift with a scream of ecstasy.
column3: Her head made a bow; her eyes went to sleep and woke again; she had a voice that said two words-more precious than two thousand in the mouth of a mere living creature. Kitty's arms opened and embraced her gift with a scream of ecstasy.

column2: That fervent pressure found its way to the right spring.
column3: That fervent pressure found its way to the right spring.

column2: The doll squeaked: "Mamma!"--and creaked--and cried again--and said: "Papa!" Kitty sat down on the floor; her legs would support her no longer.
column3: The doll squeaked: "Mamma!"--and creaked-and cried again-and said: "Papa!" Kitty sat down on the floor; her legs would support her no longer.

column2: I think I shall faint, she said quite seriously.
column3: I think I shall faint, she said quite seriously.

column2: In the midst of the general laughter, Sydney silently placed a new toy (a pretty little imitation of a jeweler's casket) at Kitty's side, and drew back before the child could look at her.
column3: In the midst of the general laughter, Sydney silently placed a new toy (a pretty little imitation of a jeweler's casket) at Kitty's side, and drew back before the child could look at her.

column2: Mrs. Presty was the only person present who noticed her pale face and the trembling of her hands as she made the effort which preserved her composure.
column3: mrs Presty was the only person present who noticed her pale face and the trembling of her hands as she made the effort which preserved her composure.

column2: The doll's necklace, bracelets, and watch and chain, riveted Kitty's attention on the casket.
column3: The doll's necklace, bracelets, and watch and chain, riveted Kitty's attention on the casket.

column2: Just as she thought of looking round for her dear Syd, her father produced a new outburst of delight by presenting a perambulator worthy of the doll.
column3: Just as she thought of looking round for her dear Syd, her father produced a new outburst of delight by presenting a perambulator worthy of the doll.

column2: Her uncle followed with a parasol, devoted to the preservation of the doll's complexion when she went out for an airing.
column3: Her uncle followed with a parasol, devoted to the preservation of the doll's complexion when she went out for an airing.

column2: Then there came a pause.
column3: Then there came a pause.

column2: Where was the generous grandmother's gift?
column3: Where was the generous grandmother's gift?

column2: Nobody remembered it; Mrs. Presty herself discovered the inestimable sixpenny picture-book cast away and forgotten on a distant window-seat.
column3: Nobody remembered it; mrs Presty herself discovered the inestimable sixpenny picture book cast away and forgotten on a distant window seat.

column2: I have a great mind to keep this, she said to Kitty, "till you are old enough to value it properly." In the moment of her absence at the window, Linley's mother-in-law lost the chance of seeing him whisper to Sydney.
column3: I have a great mind to keep this, she said to Kitty, "till you are old enough to value it properly." In the moment of her absence at the window, Linley's mother in law lost the chance of seeing him whisper to Sydney.

column2: Meet me in the shrubbery in half an hour, he said.
column3: Meet me in the shrubbery in half an hour, he said.

column2: She stepped back from him, startled by the proposal. When Mrs. Presty was in the middle of the room again, Linley and the governess were no longer near each other.
column3: She stepped back from him, startled by the proposal. When mrs Presty was in the middle of the room again, Linley and the governess were no longer near each other.

column2: Having by this time recovered herself, Kitty got on her legs.
column3: Having by this time recovered herself, Kitty got on her legs.

column2: Now, the spoiled child declared, addressing the company present, "I'm going to play."
column3: Now, the spoiled child declared, addressing the company present, "I'm going to play."

column2: The doll was put into the perambulator, and was wheeled about the room, while Mrs. Linley moved the chairs out of the way, and Randal attended with the open parasol--under orders to "pretend that the sun was shining." Once more the sixpenny picture-book was neglected.
column3: The doll was put into the perambulator, and was wheeled about the room, while mrs Linley moved the chairs out of the way, and Randal attended with the open parasol-under orders to "pretend that the sun was shining." Once more the sixpenny picture book was neglected.

column2: Mrs. Presty picked it up from the floor, determined by this time to hold it in reserve until her ungrateful grandchild reached years of discretion.
column3: mrs Presty picked it up from the floor, determined by this time to hold it in reserve until her ungrateful grandchild reached years of discretion.

column2: She put it in the bookcase between Byron's "Don Juan" and Butler's "Lives of the Saints." In the position which she now occupied, Linley was visible approaching Sydney again.
column3: She put it in the bookcase between Byron's "Don Juan" and Butler's "Lives of the Saints." In the position which she now occupied, Linley was visible approaching Sydney again.

column2: Your own interests are seriously concerned, he whispered, "in something that I have to tell you."
column3: Your own interests are seriously concerned, he whispered, "in something that I have to tell you."

column2: Incapable of hearing what passed between them, Mrs. Presty could see that a secret understanding united her son-in-law and the governess.
column3: Incapable of hearing what passed between them, mrs Presty could see that a secret understanding united her son in law and the governess.

column2: She looked round cautiously at Mrs. Linley.
column3: She looked round cautiously at mrs Linley.

column2: Kitty's humor had changed; she was now eager to see the doll's splendid clothes taken off and put on again.
column3: Kitty's humor had changed; she was now eager to see the doll's splendid clothes taken off and put on again.

column2: Come and look at it, she said to Sydney; "I want you to enjoy my birthday as much as I do." Left by himself, Randal got rid of the parasol by putting it on a table near the door.
column3: Come and look at it, she said to Sydney; "I want you to enjoy my birthday as much as I do." Left by himself, Randal got rid of the parasol by putting it on a table near the door.

column2: Mrs. Presty beckoned to him to join her at the further end of the room.
column3: mrs Presty beckoned to him to join her at the further end of the room.

column2: I want you to do me a favor, she began.
column3: I want you to do me a favor, she began.

column2: Glancing at Linley before she proceeded, Mrs. Presty took up a newspaper, and affected to be consulting Randal's opinion on a passage which had attracted her attention.
column3: Glancing at Linley before she proceeded, mrs Presty took up a newspaper, and affected to be consulting Randal's opinion on a passage which had attracted her attention.

column2: Your brother is looking our way, she whispered: "he mustn't suspect that there is a secret between us."
column3: Your brother is looking our way, she whispered: "he mustn't suspect that there is a secret between us."

column2: False pretenses of any kind invariably irritated Randal.
column3: False pretenses of any kind invariably irritated Randal.

column2: What do you want me to do? he asked sharply.
column3: What do you want me to do? he asked sharply.

column2: The reply only increased his perplexity.
column3: The reply only increased his perplexity.

column2: Observe Miss Westerfield and your brother.	Observe Miss Westerfield and your brother.

column2: Look at them now."
column3: Look at them now."

column2: Randal obeyed.
column3: Randal obeyed.

column2: What is there to look at? he inquired.
column3: What is there to look at? he inquired.

column2: Can't you see?
column3: Can't you see?

column2: I see they are talking to each other.
column3: I see they are talking to each other.

column2: Look again."
column3: Look again."

column2: Randal fixed his eyes on Mrs. Presty, with an expression which showed his dislike of that lady a little too plainly.
column3: Randal fixed his eyes on mrs Presty, with an expression which showed his dislike of that lady a little too plainly.

column2: Before he could answer what she had just said to him, his lively little niece hit on a new idea.
column3: Before he could answer what she had just said to him, his lively little niece hit on a new idea.

column2: The sun was shining, the flowers were in their brightest beauty--and the doll had not yet been taken into the garden!
column3: The sun was shining, the flowers were in their brightest beauty-and the doll had not yet been taken into the garden!

column2: Kitty at once led the way out; so completely preoccupied in steering the perambulator in a straight course that she forgot her uncle and the parasol.
column3: Kitty at once led the way out; so completely preoccupied in steering the perambulator in a straight course that she forgot her uncle and the parasol.

column2: Only waiting to remind her husband and Sydney that they were wasting the beautiful summer morning indoors, Mrs. Linley followed her daughter--and innocently placed a fatal obstacle in Mrs. Presty's way by leaving the room.
column3: Only waiting to remind her husband and Sydney that they were wasting the beautiful summer morning indoors, mrs Linley followed her daughter-and innocently placed a fatal obstacle in mrs Presty's way by leaving the room.

column2: Having consulted each other by a look, Linley and the governess went out next.
column3: Having consulted each other by a look, Linley and the governess went out next.

column2: Left alone with Randal, Mrs. Presty's anger, under the complete overthrow of her carefully-laid scheme, set restraint at defiance.
column3: Left alone with Randal, mrs Presty's anger, under the complete overthrow of her carefully laid scheme, set restraint at defiance.

column2: My daughter's married life is a wreck, she burst out, pointing theatrically to the door by which Linley and Sydney Westerfield had retired.
column3: My daughter's married life is a wreck, she burst out, pointing theatrically to the door by which Linley and Sydney Westerfield had retired.

column2: And Catherine has the vile creature whom your brother picked up in London to thank for it!	And Catherine has the vile creature whom your brother picked up in London to thank for it!

column2: Now do you understand me?"
column3: Now do you understand me?"

column2: Less than ever, Randal answered--"unless you have taken leave of your senses."
column3: Less than ever, Randal answered-"unless you have taken leave of your senses."

column2: Mrs. Presty recovered the command of her temper.
column3: mrs Presty recovered the command of her temper.

column2: On that fine morning her daughter might remain in the garden until the luncheon-bell rang.
column3: On that fine morning her daughter might remain in the garden until the luncheon bell rang.

column2: Linley had only to say that he wished to speak with his wife; and the private interview which he had so rudely insisted on as his sole privilege, would assuredly take place.
column3: Linley had only to say that he wished to speak with his wife; and the private interview which he had so rudely insisted on as his sole privilege, would assuredly take place.

column2: The one chance left of still defeating him on his own ground was to force Randal to interfere by convincing him of his brother's guilt.
column3: The one chance left of still defeating him on his own ground was to force Randal to interfere by convincing him of his brother's guilt.

column2: Moderation of language and composure of manner offered the only hopeful prospect of reaching this end.
column3: Moderation of language and composure of manner offered the only hopeful prospect of reaching this end.

column2: Mrs. Presty assumed the disguise of patient submission, and used the irresistible influence of good humor and good sense.
column3: mrs Presty assumed the disguise of patient submission, and used the irresistible influence of good humor and good sense.

column2: I don't complain, dear Randal, of what you have said to me, she replied.

column2: Sit down, if you please.

column2: I won't detain you for more than a few minutes."
column3: I won't detain you for more than a few minutes."

column3: Randal had not anticipated such moderation as this; he took the chair that was nearest to mrs Presty.

column2: They were both now sitting with their backs turned to the entrance from the library to the drawing-room.
column3: They were both now sitting with their backs turned to the entrance from the library to the drawing room.

column3: I won't trouble you with my own impressions, mrs Presty went on. "I will be careful only to mention what I have seen and heard.

column2: If you refuse to believe me, I refer you to the guilty persons themselves."
column3: If you refuse to believe me, I refer you to the guilty persons themselves."

column3: Your mother is bound to open your eyes to the truth. You have a rival in your husband's affections; and that rival is your governess.

column3: He addressed himself gently and respectfully to his sister in law.

column3: If there was any one distinct thought in her at that moment, it was the thought of her husband.

column3: May I take the parasol?"
